quote: I am not the potter, not the potter's wheel, but the potter's clay; is not the value of the shape attained as dependent upon the intrinsic worth of the clay as upon the wheel and the Master's skill?
quote_letters: I AM NOT THE POTTER NOT THE POTTERS WHEEL BUT THE POTTERS CLAY IS NOT THE VALUE OF THE SHAPE ATTAINED AS DEPENDENT UPON THE INTRINSIC WORTH OF THE CLAY AS UPON THE WHEEL AND THE MASTERS SKILL
